titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Hugh R. McKean Rice Institute memoir, 1918-1922 MS 379

note.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

change.item: finding aid revisiion description not supplied

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Hugh R. McKean Rice Institute memoir
did.abstract: This collection contains the autobiographical memoir of Hugh R. McKean, Rice Alumnus, class of 1922. The memoirs cover the early 20th century (through 1922) and for the most part describe the life of a farmer's family in South Texas. A fair amount of the memoirs concern his years as a student, letterman, and Hohenthal Award winner at the Rice Institute. In addition, the memoirs provide McKean's observations about events in Houston during the WWI era.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Hugh R. McKean was born in Northwestern Iowa in 1899; his family settled in Texas shortly thereafter, living in North Texas, Long Creek, Port Lavaca, and finally Rosenberg and the Houston area. McKean was a student, letterman, and Hohenthal Award winner at the Rice Institute, from which he graduated in 1922.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the autobiographical memoirs of Hugh R. McKean, Rice Alumnus, class of 1922. The memoirs cover the early 20th century (through 1922) and for the most part describe the life of a farmer's family in South Texas. A fair amount of the memoirs concern his years as a student, letterman, and Hohenthal Award winner at the Rice Institute. In addition, the memoirs provide McKean's observations about events in Houston during the WWI era.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift from Hugh R. McKean received Jan. 14, 1983.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Hugh R. McKean Rice Institute memoir, 1918-1922, MS 379, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Hugh R. McKean Rice Institute memoir must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

did.unittitle: Manuscript (56 pages) written by McKean about life in South Texas in the 1920s and his years as a student at Rice Institute and his observations of Houston during the WWI era.
